column1: Jaspur is a developing town and a municipal board in Udham Singh Nagar district in the Indian state of Uttarakhand.

column1: Jaspur is located at 29.28°N 78.82°E﻿ / 29.28; 78.82. It has an average elevation of 320 metres (1050 feet). It is a small city
column3: Ramnagar and 210 km from New Delhi. It is 110 km from Nainital. It is the border town of Uttarakhand.

column1: It is well connected to all major cities of the states and region. NH-74 connects Haridwar in Uttranchal with Bareilly in Uttar Pradesh via Pilibhit. The total length of NH 74 is 333 km. It connects Jaspur to major cities like Haldwani
column7: Haridwar and Dehradun. The town has its own local bus stand
column8: while the government bus station lies on the outskirts of the city. The railway project is proposed to begin soon in the town connecting Kashipur to Dhampur via Jaspur.

column1: The majority of the population is Hindu
column3: along with a smaller Muslim community.  The city is an example of religious harmony and there has never been any incident of communal strife. All the people take part in each other's festivals. Hindus are invited to the Roza-Iftar party
column4: and Muslims take part in Hindu festival Holi. All people are invited to the Buddhist festivals.

column1: Jaspur also known as wood city of India
column2: it has a traditional wood mandi and some agro-processing industries. Many people in the city are self-employed and run shops
column3: though the economy of the city is mainly based on agriculture. There is a sugar mill at Nandehi near the city
column4: and many rice and paper mills in the vicinity of the city. The town has a number of hospitals. A number of businesses are well settled in the town such as automobile

column1: The town has a number of best in class banquets halls in the region.
Temples include the historical Buddhist Monastery at the village of Bahadurpur
